subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Where's everyone gone?
msgSnippet: Josh Cogliati wrote: On Mon, Jun 24, 2002 at 10:19:05AM +0100, ... An alternative is to use pfaedit to convert the truetype font to a pfa font. Josh: I am
messageBody:
Josh Cogliati wrote:
 On Mon, Jun 24, 2002 at 10:19:05AM +0100, Michael Fitzgerald wrote:
> Hi Paige,
>
> >I believe I have to get some
> > type of program to
> > permit Linux to work with the truetype fonts.
An alternative is to use pfaedit to convert the truetype font
to a pfa font.
Josh:

I am using RedHat Linux and Netscape to access the net.  If I want to type in QS, I can use the Jerome font which is a truetype font, but this doesn't work in Linux.  So if I convert the font to a pfa, this should work?  Where do I get pfaedit?  Thanks for the help.  Also thanks to Michael for his response to my query.

Paige
 

>Josh Cogliati
jjc@...
This message created in Linux, the choice of a GNU generation.
